title: Ticket #3915: Classad time_t values should be changed from double to int64
description:
Some time_t values published into ClassAds are currently published as floating point because the could not reasonably fit into 32-bit integers. Now that the ClassAd native integer type is 64-bit, we should be publishing time_t values as integers. This is especially important now that we print out double values from ClassAds in exponential notation, which will break scripts that were naively parsing floats as ints.

attributes that should be fixed are 

    ATTR_JOB_REMOTE_WALL_CLOCK
    ATTR_JOB_LOCAL_USER_CPU
    ATTR_JOB_LOCAL_SYS_CPU
    ATTR_JOB_REMOTE_USER_CPU
    ATTR_JOB_REMOTE_SYS_CPU
